About the program 
The International Ph.D. Program in Indigenous Studies at the College of Indigenous Studies, National Dong Hwa University, Taiwan, is designed for international students and caters to the needs of those interested in pursuing Indigenous Studies for a doctoral degree. Fully taught in English, we provide students with an in-depth understanding of political and social philosophy, ecological systems, media, communication, and cultural issues relevant to Taiwan's Indigenous Peoples and the world. This program prepares students for academia, policymaking, and social justice careers, contributing to promoting Indigenous cultures and communities around the globe.


About this opportunity
•Full Time
•Tenure-track 
•Applications close on August 30, 2024, at 5.00 pm (GMT+8)

We are seeking a teaching position at the assistant professor, associate professor, or professor level in Taiwan, Austronesia, and Global Indigenous Studies. We are also considering applications from lecturers. The position will be effective on February 1, 2025.

The role includes (but is not limited to) curriculum and assessment design, research outputs, and expanding international scholarly collaborations. You will also perform research, administrative and other activities associated with the Program. 


Eligibility 
•Ph.D. in Indigenous Studies or related fields.
•Experience in using English as a medium of instruction.
•Practical experience in working with indigenous communities in Taiwan or overseas.


How to apply?  
All applicants must submit the following documents in order for your application to be considered:  
•Cover Letter
•Resume (including publications within the past five years)
•3 letters of recommendation (can be sent by email)
•Ph.D. dissertation
•B.A./ M.A./ Ph.D. degree certificates and transcripts
Please submit the following certificate suppose you are a citizen of Taiwan and earned your Ph.D. overseas:
(1) Foreign degree verified by the Embassies and Missions Abroad, Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Taiwan, R.O.C.
 (2) Entry and exit dates
•List of course releases for the Program
•Applicants who were or are currently a Lecturer, Assistant Professor, or above in Taiwan, please submit the following:
(1)	The certificate issued by the Ministry of Education (MOE)
(2)	Course syllabus and evaluations from within the past five years
•Application for Teaching Position Checklist
•Other related documentation

Please send the application in print and through email to:

About the selection process 
As part of the selection process, applicants shortlisted for interviews must demonstrate their English teaching skills to Program Committee Members. 


 Questions? 
To discuss this role, please contact Professor Dr. Chung-Shan Shih, Dean of the College of Indigenous Studies, at cshih1970@gms.ndhu.edu.tw

For application queries, please contact Ms. Dungi at dungi@gms.ndhu.edu.tw 

 
Background Checks: All final applicants for this position may be asked to consent to a criminal record check. Please note that people with criminal records are not automatically barred from applying for this position, and each application will be considered on its merits.
